intro: Radlkoferella dominigensis, commonly known as the Dominican violet, is a rare flowering plant native to the Dominican Republic. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats within the tropical rainforests of its native region. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a smooth, glossy texture. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
